body_html:
The problem here is that Tensorflow dlopen libcuda.so instead of the soname libcuda.so.1.

@ruffsl After reading the code more thoroughly here is a workaround (don't ask me why):
ln -s /usr/local/nvidia/lib64/libcuda.so.1 /usr/bin/driver/driver_sh.runfiles/third_party/gpus/cuda/lib64/libcuda.so

This works too:
ln -s /usr/local/nvidia/lib64/libcuda.so.1 /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcuda.so

body:
The problem here is that Tensorflow dlopen `libcuda.so` instead of the soname `libcuda.so.1`.

@ruffsl After reading the [code](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/97f585d506cccc57dc98f234f4d5fcd824dd3c03/tensorflow/stream_executor/dso_loader.cc#L125-L176)  more thoroughly here is a workaround (don't ask me why):
`ln -s /usr/local/nvidia/lib64/libcuda.so.1 /usr/bin/driver/driver_sh.runfiles/third_party/gpus/cuda/lib64/libcuda.so`

This works too: 
`ln -s /usr/local/nvidia/lib64/libcuda.so.1 /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcuda.so`
